title: BREAKING: 3rd person charged with murder in Toone double homicide
content:
HARDEMAN COUNTY, Tenn. — The TBI has arrested a third person in connection with a double homicide last week in Toone.
Adrian Monique Bullock, 21, has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder, according to a TBI release.
She is in custody at the Hardeman County Jail.
Bullock is charged in the deaths of 13-year-old Javarrie “Jojo” Robertson and his father, Joe “Joe Duke” Robertson, 38.
Investigators say the two were shot to death Oct. 21 at the father’s home on Naylor Road in Toone.
Damein Hamer, 25, and Jeremy Hamer, 29, also were arrested Wednesday and both are charged with two counts of first-degree murder in the case.
The investigation is ongoing, and the TBI says more charges and arrests are possible. Anyone with information is urged to call 1-800-TBI-FIND.
We’ll have the latest on this developing story this evening on WBBJ 7 Eyewitness News.
